Q.1. WHAT IS YOUR ARMY RANK OR GRADE*  1. PRIVATE OR PRIVATE FIRST CLASS 2. TECHNICIAN 5TH GRADE OR CORPORAL 3. TECHNICIAN 4TH GRADE OR SERGEANT 4. FIRST THREE GRADES - STAFF SERGEANT, TECHNICIAN 3RD GRADE, OR HIGHER 0. NO ANSWER

Q.2. HOW OLD WERE YOU ON YOUR LAST BIRTHDAY*  01. EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE OR LESS 02. NINETEEN 03. TWENTY 04. TWENTY-ONE 05. TWENTY-TWO 06. TWENTY-THREE 07. TWENTY-FOUR 08. 25-29 09. 30-34 10. 35 AND OVER 00. NO ANSWER

Q.3. HOW FAR DID YOU GO IN SCHOOL*  1. LESS THAN 6TH GRADE 2. FINISHED 6TH GRADE 3. FINISHED 7TH GRADE 4. FINISHED 8TH GRADE 5. SOME HIGH SCHOOL BUT DID NOT FINISH 6. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 7. SOME COLLEGE BUT DID NOT FINISH 8. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE 0. NO ANSWER

Q.4. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN OVERSEAS (COUNT FROM THE TIME YOU LEFT THE STATES)*  1. 6 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 6 TO 12 MONTHS 3. OVER 12 TO 18 MONTHS 4. OVER 18 MONTHS TO 2 YEARS 5. OVER 2 TO 3 YEARS 6. OVER 3 YEARS 7. NATIVES OF OAHU 0. NO ANSWER

Q.5. WHAT BRANCH OF THE ARMY ARE YOU IN*  01. ENGINEERS 02. FIELD ARTILLERY 03. QUARTERMASTER 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. SIGNAL CORPS 07. COAST ARTILLERY 08. ARMORED (TANKS AND TANK DESTROYERS) 09. ANTI-AIRCRAFT 10. AIR CORPS 11. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 12. TRANSPORTATION CORPS 13. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 14. MILITARY POLICE 15. OTHER (WHICH ONE) 00. NO ANSWER
Q.6. ARE YOU:  1. SINGLE 2. MARRIED, NO CHILDREN 3. MARRIED, WITH ONE OR MORE CHILDREN 4. WIDOWED, DIVORCED, OR SEPARATED 0. NO ANSWER
Q.7. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN WITH YOUR PRESENT OUTFIT*  1. LESS THAN 3 MONTHS 2. 3 TO 6 MONTHS 3. 6 TO 12 MONTHS 4. OVER 12 MONTHS 0. NO ANSWER

Q.8. IN GENERAL, DO YOU THINK THE ARMY HAS TRIED ITS BEST TO SEE THAT MEN GET AS SQUARE A DEAL AS POSSIBLE*  1. YES, IT HAS TRIED ITS BEST 2. IT HAS TRIED SOME, BUT NOT HARD ENOUGH 3. IT HAS HARDLY TRIED AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

Q.9. IN GENERAL, DO YOU FEEL YOU YOURSELF HAVE GOT A SQUARE DEAL FROM THE ARMY*  1. YES, IN MOST WAYS I HAVE 2. IN SOME WAYS, YES, IN OTHER WAYS, NO 3. NO, ON THE WHOLE I HAVE NOT GOT A SQUARE DEAL 0. NO ANSWER

Q.10. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT WHAT YOU,VE DONE IN THIS WAR*  1. I FEEL I,VE ALREADY DONE MY SHARE AS A SOLDIER AND SHOULD BE DISCHARGED 2. I FEEL I,VE ALREADY DONE MY SHARE, BUT I,M WILLING TO DO MORE 3. I DON,T FEEL THAT I,VE DONE MY SHARE YET 0. NO ANSWER

Q.11. HOW SATISFIED ARE YOU ABOUT BEING IN YOUR PRESENT ARMY JOB INSTEAD OF SOME OTHER ARMY JOB*  1. VERY SATISFIED 2. SATISFIED 3. IT DOES NOT MAKE ANY DIFFERENCE TO ME 4. DISSATISFIED 5. VERY DISSATISFIED 0. NO ANSWER

Q.12. ON THE WHOLE, HOW IS THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT*  1. VERY HIGH 2. FAIRLY HIGH 3. JUST SO-SO 4. FAIRLY LOW 5. VERY LOW 0. NO ANSWER P. THE OFFICE OF THE SURGEON, PACIFIC OCEAN AREAS, IS INTERESTED IN FINDING OUT ABOUT THE HEALTH OF SOLDIERS LIKE YOURSELF. PLEASE ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS CAREFULLY EVEN THOUGH SOME OF THEM MAY SOUND STRANGE TO YOU.
Q.13A. ARE YOU EVER TROUBLED BY YOUR HANDS SWEATING SO THAT THEY FEEL DAMP AND CLAMMY*  1. YES, OFTEN 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
Q.13B. HOW OFTEN ARE YOU BOTHERED BY HAVING AN UPSET STOMACH*  1. NEARLY ALL THE TIME 2. PRETTY OFTEN 3. NOT VERY OFTEN 4. NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
Q.13C. DO YOU OFTEN HAVE TROUBLE IN GETTING TO SLEEP OR STAYING ASLEEP*  1. VERY OFTEN 2. SOMETIMES 3. ALMOST NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
Q.13D. DO YOUR HANDS EVER TREMBLE ENOUGH TO BOTHER YOU*  1. YES, OFTEN 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
Q.13E. ARE YOU EVER BOTHERED BY NERVOUSNESS*  1. YES, OFTEN 2. YES, SOMETIMES 3. NO, NEVER 0. NO ANSWER
Q.13F. ARE YOU EVER WORRIED AND UPSET*  1. I AM HARDLY EVER WORRIED AND UPSET 2. I AM SOMETIMES WORRIED AND UPSET 3. I AM OFTEN WORRIED AND UPSET 0. NO ANSWER
Q.13G. IN GENERAL, WHAT SORT OF A TIME DO YOU HAVE IN THE ARMY*  1. I HAVE A PRETTY GOOD TIME 2. IT,S ABOUT FIFTY-FIFTY 3. I HAVE A PRETTY ROTTEN TIME 0. NO ANSWER

Q.13H. IN GENERAL, HOW WOULD YOU SAY YOU FEEL MOST OF THE TIME, IN GOOD SPIRITS OR IN LOW SPIRITS*  1. I AM USUALLY IN GOOD SPIRITS 2. I AM IN GOOD SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME AND IN LOW SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME 3. I AM USUALLY IN LOW SPIRITS 0. NO ANSWER

Q.25F. WHAT HAPPENED WHEN YOU LEFT THE DISPENSARY*  1. I WAS SENT TO THE HOSPITAL 2. I WAS SENT TO MY QUARTERS AND EXCUSED FROM DUTY 3. I WAS RETURNED TO MY REGULAR DUTY 9. I HAVE NEVER BEEN TO AN ARMY DISPENSARY FOR MEDICAL CARE SINCE I CAME OVERSEAS 0. NO ANSWER

Q.25H. (IF YOUR ANSWER WAS NO), WHAT DO YOU THINK SHOULD HAVE BEEN DONE*  1. SHOULD HAVE BEEN SENT TO HOSPITAL 2. SHOULD HAVE BEEN SENT TO QUARTERS AND EXCUSED FROM DUTY 3. SHOULD HAVE BEEN RETURNED TO REGULAR DUTY 9. I HAVE NEVER BEEN TO AN ARMY DISPENSARY FOR MEDICAL CARE SINCE I CAME OVERSEAS 0. NO ANSWER P. EVERYONE SHOULD ANSWER THE QUESTIONS FROM HERE ON.

Q.26. IN YOUR OPINION, ARE MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT EVER SENT BACK TO DUTY FROM THE DISPENSARY AND MADE TO WORK WHEN THEY ARE TOO SICK OR NOT REALLY ABLE TO DO THEIR JOBS*  1. THIS NEVER HAPPENS 2. THIS MAY HAPPEN ONCE IN A WHILE, BUT NOT TOO OFTEN 3. IT HAPPENS TOO OFTEN 0. NO ANSWER P. HERE ARE FOUR QUESTIONS ABOUT WHETHER MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT ARE SUSPECTED OF "GOLDBRICKING" WHEN THEY GO ON SICK CALL:

Q.28. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE WAY YOUR OUTFIT HANDLES GOLD- BRICKS (READ ALL THREE OF THESE ANSWERS CAREFULLY AND THEN CHECK THE ONE WHICH BEST EXPRESSES YOUR OPINION)*  1. THIS OUTFIT IS TOO EASY ON GOLD-BRICKS - TOO MANY MEN GET BY WITH GOING ON SICK CALL JUST TO GET OUT OF SOMETHING 2. THIS OUTFIT HANDLES GOLD-BRICKS ABOUT RIGHT - SICK MEN ARE NOT ACCUSED OF RIDING THE SICK BOOK, BUT A REAL GOLD- BRICK WILL NOT GET BY WITH IT VERY MANY TIMES 3. THIS OUTFIT CALLS TOO MANY MEN GOLD-BRICKS - TOO MANY MEN WHO REALLY HAVE SOMETHING WRONG WITH THEM ARE ACCUSED OF RIDING THE SICK BOOK 0. NO ANSWER

Q.31. WHEN A SOLDIER DIES IN THE SERVICE, IS HIS ARMY INSURANCE PAID TO HIS FAMILY IN ONE CASH PAYMENT OR IN A SERIES OF MONTHLY INSTALLMENTS*  1. IN ONE CASH PAYMENT 2. IN A SERIES OF MONTHLY INSTALLMENTS 3. EITHER WAY HIS FAMILY WISHES TO GET IT 4. DON,T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER

Q.32. WHAT IS THE SMALLEST AMOUNT OF MONEY WHICH A SOLDIER CAN HAVE DEDUCTED FROM HIS PAY EACH MONTH FOR THE PURCHASE OF WAR BONDS ON THE ALLOTMENT PLAN*  1. ANY AMOUNT THAT HE WISHES 2. $5.00 3. $7.50 4. $18.75 5. $22.50 6. DON,T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER P. HERE ARE FOUR MORE QUESTIONS THAT HAVE "RIGHT" ANSWERS.

Q.34. HOW CAN SOLDIERS PUT MONEY INTO SOLDIERS, DEPOSITS*  1. ONLY BY DEPOSITING ACTUAL CASH 2. ONLY BY HAVING MONEY DEDUCTED FROM THEIR PAY WHEN THE PAYROLL IS MADE UP 3. EITHER BY PAYROLL DEDUCTIONS OR BY HANDING OVER ACTUAL CASH 4. DON,T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER
Q.35. UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS CAN A SOLDIER WITHDRAW MONEY FROM A SOLDIER,S DEPOSITS ACCOUNT*  1. ONLY WHEN HE IS DISCHARGED FROM THE ARMY 2. NOT CHOSEN
Q.35. UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS CAN A SOLDIER WITHDRAW MONEY FROM A SOLDIER,S DEPOSITS ACCOUNT*  343 1. ONLY IN CASE OF EXTREME EMERGENCY 2069 2. NOT CHOSEN
Q.35. UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS CAN A SOLDIER WITHDRAW MONEY FROM A SOLDIER,S DEPOSITS ACCOUNT*  1128 1. FOR ANY GOOD REASON IF HIS COMMANDING OFFICER APPROVES IT 1284 2. NOT CHOSEN
Q.35. UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS CAN A SOLDIER WITHDRAW MONEY FROM A SOLDIER,S DEPOSITS ACCOUNT*  142 1. WHENEVER HE WISHES TO FOR ANY REASON 2270 2. NOT CHOSEN
Q.35. UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS CAN A SOLDIER WITHDRAW MONEY FROM A SOLDIER,S DEPOSITS ACCOUNT*  447 1. DON,T KNOW 1965 2. NOT CHOSEN
Q.35. UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS CAN A SOLDIER WITHDRAW MONEY FROM A SOLDIER,S DEPOSITS ACCOUNT*  136 1. NO ANSWER 2276 2. NOT CHOSEN

Q.36. WHAT IS THE PERSONAL TRANSFER ACCOUNT PLAN*  1. A WAY OF KEEPING A MAN,S PAY RECORDS AND ACCOUNTS STRAIGHT WHEN HE IS TRANSFERRED FROM ONE OUTFIT TO ANOTHER 2. ANOTHER NAME FOR A CLASS "E" ALLOTMENT - A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF MONEY DEDUCTED FROM A SOLDIER,S PAY EACH MONTH AND SENT HOME TO HIS FAMILY 3. A WAY OF SENDING EXTRA CASH HOME THROUGH THE ARMY FINANCE OFFICE 4. DON,T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER P. MOST OF THE QUESTIONS FROM HERE ON DO NOT HAVE ANY "RIGHT" OR "WRONG" ANSWERS. JUST GIVE YOUR OWN OPINION IN ANSWERING THEM.
